abstract: Dr Bruce Frumkin, psychologist serving as defense witness in Etan Patz murder trial, says that suspect Pedro Hernandez is vulnerable to giving false confession due to his low intelligence; prosecution counters that Hernandez understands more than defense has acknowledged.
lead_paragraph: A psychologist serving as a defense witness testified that Pedro Hernandez, who has confessed to strangling 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, was susceptible to giving a false confession because of his low intelligence.

headline.main: Patz Trial Jury Is Told Suspect Was Prone to Confessing
headline.print_headline: Patz Trial Jury Is Told Suspect Was Prone to Confessing

snippet: A psychologist serving as a defense witness testified that Pedro Hernandez, who has confessed to strangling 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, was susceptible to giving a false confession because of his low intelligence.
